Microsoft Azure.title: Microsoft Azure Cloud Service Disrupted By Multiple Fibre Cuts In Red Sea
Microsoft Azure.snippet: Microsoft announced that some Azure users might experience higher latency because of multiple undersea fibre cuts in the Red Sea. Azure users may experience increased disruptions when traffic from the Middle East originates in or terminates in Asia or Europe.

Microsoft Azure.title: Microsoft now enforces MFA on Azure Portal sign-ins for all tenants
Microsoft Azure.snippet: Microsoft says it has been enforcing multifactor authentication (MFA) for Azure Portal sign-ins across all tenants since March 2025.

Microsoft Azure.title: Azure mandatory multifactor authentication: Phase 2 starting in October 2025
Microsoft Azure.snippet: Microsoft Azure is announcing the start of Phase 2 multifactor authentication enforcement at the Azure Resource Manager layer, starting October 1, 2025.

Google Cloud.title: Google lands £400M MoD contract for secure UK cloud services
Google Cloud.snippet: The UK's Ministry of Defence has signed a £400 million ($540 million) contract with Google sovereign cloud to support security and analytics workloads.  The arrangement promises Google AI, data analytics, and cybersecurity, all in sovereign datacenters built in the UK.

Google Cloud.title: UK announces £400 million Google Cloud classified info contract
Google Cloud.snippet: The UK government announced a £400 million ($543 million) contract with Google Cloud to share classified information with the United States.  The deal will strengthen secure communication links between the UK and U.S., using Google Cloud's AI, data analytics, and cybersecurity technology.

Google Cloud.title: Google Cloud Next 2025: News and updates
Google Cloud.snippet: Google Cloud Next 2025 featured announcements on Gemini and Google Agentspace search on Google Distributed Cloud, innovations to BigQuery and Looker, Google Unified Security, and Vertex AI expanding generative media for enterprise.

Cloud Computing.title: Latest Cloud Computing News
Cloud Computing.snippet: The latest cloud computing news and articles for CIOs.  Covers topics such as Microsoft's standardized pricing for online services, SAP's investment in EU sovereign cloud, developer reliance on AI, Oracle's private data center, Nvidia's CEO praising open-source AI, and the continued dominance of AWS, Microsoft Azure, and Google Cloud in infrastructure services.

Cloud Computing.title: Cloud Computing News | Latest News
Cloud Computing.snippet: Latest news on Cloud Computing, covering AWS, Azure, Google Cloud, data centers, AI integration, SaaS, cybersecurity and enterprise cloud solutions.  Discusses the global cloud computing market exceeding £450 billion annually, AI integration, edge computing, enhanced security measures, multi-cloud adoption, and the transformation of how businesses and individuals work and collaborate.

Cloud Computing.title: Latest Cloud Tech News
Cloud Computing.snippet: Reports on the latest cloud computing news and insights, including Alibaba's research on tools to cut outages and cloud costs, Broadcom tying Private AI to VMware Cloud Foundation rollout, Meta's $10 billion cloud deal with Google, and Alibaba's planned US$3.17 billion note sale to fund cloud and AI buildout.

SaaS.title: The Big 5 Still Aren't Buying Many Startups
SaaS.snippet: Today, the Big Five — Nvidia, Apple, Microsoft, Alphabet and Amazon — have a combined market capitalization of more than $16 trillion. They've also got close to $400 billion in cash on the books between them. Even with that massive spending power, however, the largest tech companies have not bought many startups this year. We take a look.

SaaS.title: Why The Future Of SaaS Is Eat Or Be Eaten
SaaS.snippet: AI is creating an entirely new category of SaaS, one that looks beyond productivity gains to reimagine vertical industry-specific workflows.  The age of steady, incremental software improvements is over. Only the most agile and adaptive SaaS companies that will be AI first will survive the transition.

SaaS.title: ONEiO raises €8M to kill off manual IT integrations and scale its “IntegrationOps” model
SaaS.snippet: Enterprise IT is creaking. Companies are rapidly adopting cloud apps and new SaaS tools, while service ecosystems are…

Software Industry.title: InfoQ: Software Development News, Trends & Best Practices
Software Industry.snippet: InfoQ covers a wide range of software development news, including the release of new AI coding agents, updates to popular frameworks like Next.js, and discussions on best practices for software engineering.

Software Industry.title: All 'software' news | Silicon Republic
Software Industry.snippet: Silicon Republic reports on various software-related news, including start-up activities, job announcements, and the impact of AI on the software industry.

Software Industry.title: Developer | Latest Developer News, Analysis & Events
Software Industry.snippet: Developer-tech.com provides news and analysis on developer technologies, including the impact of AI on software development, cybersecurity concerns, and trends in programming languages.

Tech Industry.title: Meta launches AI app, Zuckerberg chats with Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella at developer conference
Tech Industry.snippet: Meta's Mark Zuckerberg and Microsoft's Satya Nadella discussed AI at a developer conference.

Tech Industry.title: U.S. FTC probes Google, Amazon over search advertising practices
Tech Industry.snippet: The Federal Trade Commission is investigating Google and Amazon's search advertising practices.

Tech Industry.title: Amazon rolls out expansion of same-day groceries to 1,000 cities, includes perishable items
Tech Industry.snippet: Amazon is expanding its same-day grocery delivery service to 1,000 cities.

Microsoft.title: Microsoft escapes EU antitrust fine after unbundling Teams
Microsoft.snippet: The European Commission has accepted the changes and commitments the company made in response to its concerns related to Microsoft's bundling of its Teams collaboration platform with its other apps.

Microsoft.title: Microsoft and OpenAI announce the 'next phase' of their partnership
Microsoft.snippet: Microsoft and OpenAI have issued a joint statement to say that they have signed a non-binding memorandum of understanding for the "next phase" of their partnership.

Microsoft.title: Microsoft reminds of Windows 10 support ending in 30 days
Microsoft.snippet: Microsoft advises customers who want their Windows 10 devices to keep receiving essential security updates and bug fixes to upgrade eligible systems to Windows 11 or migrate to Windows 11 in the cloud with Windows 365.

Microsoft Stock.title: Microsoft (MSFT) Stock: Surges Despite OpenAI Cutting Its Revenue Share
Microsoft Stock.snippet: Microsoft stock rose 1.77% despite OpenAI's decision to cut its partner revenue share from 20% to 8% by 2030. OpenAI's restructuring could boost its own revenue by over $50 billion, raising questions about its nonprofit roots. Microsoft has already generated billions from its early $1B OpenAI investment, primarily through Copilot and Azure services. Markets remain bullish, betting Microsoft will sustain long-term AI leadership even under new partnership terms.

Microsoft Stock.title: Anchor Investment Management LLC Increases Stake in Microsoft Corporation $MSFT
Microsoft Stock.snippet: Anchor Investment Management LLC increased its stake in Microsoft Corporation by 1.8% during Q1, now holding 105,030 shares valued at approximately $39.4 million, making it the firm's largest position. Microsoft has been actively sought by institutional investors, with new stakes acquired by hedge funds like Norges Bank and Nuveen LLC, contributing to 71.13% of the stock being held by these investors. Recent analyst reports have led to increased price targets for Microsoft shares, with projections reaching as high as $650, resulting in a consensus rating of "Moderate Buy."

Microsoft Stock.title: OpenAI to cut Microsoft revenue share to 8% (MSFT:NASDAQ)
Microsoft Stock.snippet: OpenAI expects its revenue sharing with Microsoft (NASDAQ:MSFT) and other commercial partners to drop to about 8% by 2030 from the current 20%, The Information reported shortly after the ChatGPT creator signed a deal to renegotiate its relationship with the tech giant. The adjustment could add up to more than $50B in additional revenue for the AI startup, the report said, without specifying whether it was an aggregate or annual figure. The Sam Altman-led company is also negotiating the amount it will have to pay for servers rented from Microsoft (NASDAQ:MSFT).

Satya Nadella.title: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella admits 'lack of empathy' after layoffs and return-to-office push; tells employees 'we will do better'
Satya Nadella.snippet: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella has told employees that the company needs to “do better” in rebuilding trust with its workforce. The remarks come after months of layoffs and a new return-to-office rule that the company announced recently.

Satya Nadella.title: Microsoft must rebuild trust after layoffs and RTO mandate: Satya Nadella
Satya Nadella.snippet: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella says the company must rebuild employee trust after layoffs and a return-to-office mandate, acknowledging challenges ahead.

Satya Nadella.title: 'We Will Do Better': Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella Admits 'Lack of Empathy' After Layoffs, Return-to-Office Mandate
Satya Nadella.snippet: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella admitted the need to rebuild employee trust amid layoffs and return-to-office tensions.

Microsoft Teams.title: Microsoft Teams pledges satisfy EU commission
Microsoft Teams.snippet: The European Commission has accepted commitments from Microsoft to address competition concerns linked to its popular Teams platform.  Microsoft will make available versions of its product suites without Teams and at a reduced price; allow customers with long-term licenses to switch to suites without Teams; provide interoperability for key functionalities between communication and collaboration tools that compete with Teams; and allow customers to move their data out of Teams.

Microsoft Teams.title: Microsoft Teams dispute resolved, five years after Slack complaint
Microsoft Teams.snippet: Microsoft will continue to offer versions of its Microsoft 365 suite with Teams included, although those without Teams will come at a reduced price. The company committed to improving interoperability with competing services, making it easier for customers to port their data to other platforms.

Microsoft Teams.title: Microsoft resolves European Union probe into Teams
Microsoft Teams.snippet: European Union regulators have accepted Microsoft's proposed changes to its Teams app to resolve an antitrust investigation.

Microsoft Windows.title: Microsoft Weekly: new Windows 11 updates with new features, 25H2 ISOs are here, and more
Microsoft Windows.snippet: Catch up with the latest Microsoft stories in this news recap with a lot of Windows 11 preview builds with new features, version 25H2 images, fixed bugs, and more.

Microsoft Windows.title: Microsoft reminds of Windows 10 support ending in 30 days
Microsoft Windows.snippet: After it retires Windows 10, Microsoft will stop providing bug fixes or technical assistance for issues affecting security, stability, or usability.  Windows 11 has finally surpassed Windows 10's number of installs, with over 53% of all Windows systems now running Windows 11, compared to 42% on Windows 10.

Microsoft Windows.title: Windows Latest: Your Premier Source for Microsoft News
Microsoft Windows.snippet: Various news snippets about Windows 11 updates (KB5065426, KB5065431), Windows 10 end-of-life, and  Emoji 16.0 rollout.  Also mentions the slow rollout of Windows 10's extended updates Enroll button and Microsoft's nags about Windows 10 end of life.

Antitrust.title: Microsoft's Teams concessions are accepted by EU antitrust watchdog
Antitrust.snippet: Microsoft has escaped an EU antitrust fine over the roll-out of its Teams communications service, after the European Commission accepted a broad package of commitments.

Antitrust.title: U.S. employee non-competes targeted under new Federal Trade Commission antitrust enforcement strategy
Antitrust.snippet: The FTC is using its antitrust powers to order the country's largest pet cremation company to stop enforcing non-compete agreements against its workforce. It has also sent warning letters to certain healthcare firms urging them to check their employment agreements for antitrust compliance.

Antitrust.title: Mexico's Antitrust Watchdog Decides Against Corrective Measures for Amazon and Mercado Libre
Antitrust.snippet: Mexico's antitrust watchdog Cofece reportedly found that Amazon and Mercado Libre create barriers to competition for sellers on their platforms but said it will not order corrective measures.

FTC.title: Federal Trade Commission Ends Appeals, Shifts Focus to Noncompete Enforcement
FTC.snippet: The FTC has abandoned its 2024 Noncompete Clause Rule and will now target egregious uses of noncompetes on a case-by-case basis.

FTC.title: FTC Moves to Vacate Rule Banning Noncompetes
FTC.snippet: The FTC voted to dismiss its appeal of the District Court's decision prohibiting enforcement of its nationwide noncompete rule, shifting to an enforcement action approach.

FTC.title: U.S. employee non-competes targeted under new Federal Trade Commission antitrust enforcement strategy
FTC.snippet: The FTC withdrew its sweeping non-compete rule and will now assess non-competes on a case-by-case basis, focusing enforcement actions on industries like healthcare.

EU Competition.title: EU Won't Shy Away From Tough Antitrust Enforcement, Competition Chief Says
EU Competition.snippet: The European Union's top competition enforcer said officials couldn't let Alphabet's Google avoid a 2.95 billion-euro ($3.46 billion) fine for breaching the bloc's competition rules this month.  The European Commission penalized Google over concerns about its advertising technology business in Europe.  While regulators won't shy away from fines, "soft-enforcement" and dialogue with businesses may play a bigger role in the future.

EU Competition.title: EU says it accepts Microsoft's commitments to address competition concerns over Teams platform
EU Competition.snippet: The European Commission accepted commitments from Microsoft to address competition concerns related to its Teams platform.  EU regulators found that Microsoft had granted Teams an undue competitive advantage by bundling it with its productivity applications. Microsoft unbundled Teams from Office in 2023.

EU Competition.title: Microsoft averts EU antitrust fine with unbundled Office and Teams pricing
EU Competition.snippet: Microsoft avoided a possible EU antitrust fine by offering customers reduced prices for Office products excluding Teams.  The case was triggered by complaints accusing Microsoft of bundling Teams with Office to gain an unfair advantage. Microsoft agreed to widen the price gap between Office suites with and without Teams and enhance interoperability.

Data Privacy.title: California privacy regulator unveils new cyber, risk, and automation rules
Data Privacy.snippet: Businesses operating in California will need to meet new, first-in-the-nation privacy requirements for cybersecurity, risk assessments, and automated decision-making technology, under a large expansion of rules by the state.

Data Privacy.title: Wyden Urges FTC Investigation Over Ascension Ransomware Hack
Data Privacy.snippet: Senator Ron Wyden is urging the Federal Trade Commission (FTC) to investigate the recent ransomware attack on Ascension, a large US healthcare provider, over concerns about the potential exposure of sensitive patient data.

Data Privacy.title: Study finds social media grabs, shares data
Data Privacy.snippet: A Federal Trade Commission study found social media platforms like Meta, YouTube and TikTok engage in "vast surveillance" of consumers and profit from the data by selling it to advertisers.

GDPR.title: Seven years in, GDPR faces growing challenges from AI and 'consent or pay' models
GDPR.snippet: Companies using AI tools need to start thinking about how AI fits with the core principles of data protection. With the EU AI Act now approved, companies should prepare for dual compliance, ensuring AI systems meet both GDPR and sector-specific AI obligations.

GDPR.title: GDPR Week: European Courts Reshape GDPR Enforcement and Interpretation
GDPR.snippet: In a landmark week for EU data protection law, the European Court of Justice (ECJ) and the General Court delivered three pivotal judgments that clarify the scope of GDPR enforcement, the concept of personal data, and the rights of data subjects.

GDPR.title: GDPR - latest news, breaking stories and comment
GDPR.snippet: Recent news includes articles on fraudsters using GDPR in phishing scams, the UK's preparedness for GDPR, and data breach complaints increasing since GDPR's implementation.
